metadata.title: CVE-2021-33574 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributesobject (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has beenfreed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) orpossibly unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33574` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.34-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.34-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.34-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.34-0ubuntu1').
